comments: Solutions of the equation (n-6)'+n'+(n+6)'=3, where n' is the arithmetic derivative of n. [_Paolo P. Lava_, Nov 08 2012]
references: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..1000
Joseph Hirsch, Prime Triplets, Mathematics Teacher, 62 (1969), 467ff (see p. 471).
mathematica: q=6*1;lst={};Do[p=Prime[n];If[PrimeQ[p-q]&&PrimeQ[p+q],AppendTo[lst,p]],{n,7!}];lst (* _Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, Jun 17 2009 *)Select[Prime[Range[300]],And@@PrimeQ[#+{6,-6}]&] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, May 21 2012 *)
prog: (Haskell)a006489 n = a006489_list !! (n-1)a006489_list = filter   ((== 1) . a010051 . (subtract 6)) $ dropWhile (<= 6) a023201_list-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Feb 25 2013
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
extensions: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Dec 24 1999
